text.0: in all the worlds that was the best and highest whence sprang the mighty gods of splendid valour.
text.1: as soon as born he overcomes his foemen be in whom all who lend him aid are joyful.
text.2: grown mighty in his strength with ample vigour he as a foe strikes fear into the dāsa.
text.3: eager to win the breathing and the breathless all sang thy praise at banquet and oblation.
text.4: all concentrate on thee their mental vigour what time these twice or thrice are thine assistants.
text.5: blend what is sweeter than the sweet with sweetness win quickly with our meath that meath in battle.
text.6: therefore in thee too thou who winnest riches at every banquet are the sages joyful.
text.7: with mightier power bold god extend thy firmness let not malignant yātudhānas harm thee.
text.8: proudly we put our trust in thee in battles when we behold great wealth the prize of combat.
text.9: i with my words impel thy weapons onward and sharpen with my prayer thy vital vigour.
text.10: worthy of praises manyshaped most skilful most energetic Āptya of the aptyas.
text.11: he with his might destroys the seven danus subduing many who were deemed his equals.
text.12: thou in that house which thy protection guardeth bestowest wealth the higher and the lower.
text.13: thou stablishest the two muchwandering mothers and bringest many deeds to their completion.
text.14: brhaddiva the foremost of lightwinners repeats these holy prayers this strength of indra.
text.15: he rules the great selfluminous fold of cattle and all the doors of light hath he thrown open.
text.16: thus hath brhaddiva the great atharvan spoken to indra as himself in person.
text.17: the spotless sisters they who are his mothers with power exalt him and impel him onward.
